a2818.c

00001 /*
00002         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00003 
00004         --- Caen SpA - Computing Systems Division ---
00005 
00006         a2818.c
00007 
00008         Source file for the CAEN A2818 CONET board driver.
00009 
00010         March 2007:
00011             Version 1.8:
00012                   - Register device only if HW is present otherwise the kernel
00013                     crashes with a cat /proc/devices
00014               - ioctl:A2818_IOCTL_IRQ_WAIT now returns ETIMEDOUT instead of -ETIMEDOUT, in order to give
00015                   to CAENVMElib a chance to detect IRQ timeout errors
00016 
00017         February 2007:
00018             Version 1.7:
00019             - Better error handling in the link fail: it did not reset correctly
00020               when disconnected during a communication.
00021 
00022         August 2006:
00023             Version 1.6:
00024             - Bug fix on a2818_ioctl, case A2818_IOCTL_SEND: added packet's
00025                 header build step
00026             Contributions from Brent Casavant at Silicon Graphics, Inc. (bcasavan@sgi.com)
00027             - Port to 64-bit architectures
00028             - Ensure writes are flushed to I/O domain where necessary ( Linux Version>= 2.6.10)
00029             - Allocate DMA memory correctly for architectures with IOMMUs (Linux Version >= 2.6.9)
00030             - Unlocked ioctl() method alleviates system performacne problems ( Linux Version>= 2.6.11)
00031 
00032 
00033         January 2006:
00034             Version 1.5:
00035             - Kernel 2.6.9 porting
00036                         - A2818_IOCTL_REV added: get driver revision
00037 
00038         December 2005:
00039             Version 1.4:
00040             - SMP compliance bug fixing.
00041 
00042         August 2005:
00043             Version 1.3:
00044             - SMP compliance.
00045             - Fixed the automatic link reset handling.
00046 
00047         May    2005 :
00048             Version 1.2:
00049             - Fixed a bug on minor number handling.
00050             - Fixed the reading of status word at the and of the last packet.
00051             - Now we use kmap_atomic instead of page_address to solve problems
00052               with some installations.
00053             - Introduced the test on link fail condition and the link reset
00054               in order to avoid the need of driver reloading.
00055 
00056         June   2004 : Created.
00057 
00058         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 */
00060 #define DEBUG     0
00061 #define SETCLR    1

00063 
00064 #ifndef VERSION
00065         #define VERSION(ver,rel,seq) (((ver)<<16) | ((rel)<<8) | (seq))
00066 #endif

00135 #define DMAREAD_DONE (readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR) & DMACSR_DONE_0)

00137 #ifndef SETCLR
00138 #define ENABLE_RX_INT \
00139 {\
00140 /* Rev 1.6 */ \

00142         writel(r & ~A2818_INTDIS, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL); \
00143 /* Rev 1.6 */ \

00146 #else

00148 /* Rev 1.6 */ \

00150         writel(A2818_INTDIS, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL_CLR);\
00151         a2818_mmiowb(); \
00152 }
00153 #endif

00156 #define DISABLE_RX_INT \
00157 {\
00158 /* Rev 1.6 */ \

00160         writel(r | A2818_INTDIS, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL); \
00161 /* Rev 1.6 */ \
00162         a2818_mmiowb(); \
00163 }
00164 #else
00165 #define DISABLE_RX_INT /* \
00166 // 1.4    \
00167 {\
00168         writel(A2818_INTDIS, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL_SET);\
00169 // Rev 1.6 \
00170         a2818_mmiowb(); \
00171 }
00172 */
00173 #endif
00174

00275 /*
00276         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00277 
00278         a2818_enable_int (Usata solo nella init)
00279 
00280         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00281 */
00282 static void a2818_enable_int(struct a2818_state *s)
00283 {
00284 //Rev. 1.6
00285         uint32_t plx_intcsr;
00286 
00287         /* Enable interrupts on the PLX bridge */
00288         plx_intcsr = INTCSR_LOC_INT_ENA | INTCSR_PCI_INT_ENA |
00289                      INTCSR_DMA0_INT_ENA | INTCSR_DMA1_INT_ENA;
00290         writel(plx_intcsr, s->plx_vir + PLX_INTCSR);
00291 
00292         /* Enable VME interrupt to PCI interrupt routing */
00293         ENABLE_VME_INT
00294 
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*
00298         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00299 
00300         a2818_dma_conf (Usata solo nella init)
00301 
00302         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00303 */
00304 static void a2818_dma_conf(struct a2818_state *s)
00305 {
00306 // Rev 1.6
00307         uint32_t plx_dmamode;
00308 
00309         /* Configure local to PCI (read) DMA channel (0) */
00310         plx_dmamode = DMAMODE_DW32 | DMAMODE_READY_ENA |
00311                       DMAMODE_BTERM_ENA | DMAMODE_BURST_ENA |
00312                       DMAMODE_DONE_INT_ENA | DMAMODE_LOC_ADR_HOLD |
00313                       DMAMODE_EOT_ENA | DMAMODE_INT_PCI | DMAMODE_FAST_TERM;
00314         writel(plx_dmamode, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAMODE0);
00315 // Rev. 1.6
00316 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
00317         writel(virt_to_bus(s->i_buf), s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAPADR0);
00318 #else
00319         writel(s->i_buf_pci, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAPADR0);
00320 #endif
00321         writel(A2818_RXFIFO, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMALADR0);
00322         writel(0xF, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMADPR0);
00323 
00324         /* Configure PCI to local (write) DMA channel (1) */
00325         plx_dmamode = DMAMODE_DW32 | DMAMODE_READY_ENA |
00326                       DMAMODE_BTERM_ENA | DMAMODE_BURST_ENA |
00327                       DMAMODE_DONE_INT_ENA | DMAMODE_LOC_ADR_HOLD |
00328                       DMAMODE_EOT_ENA | DMAMODE_INT_PCI | DMAMODE_FAST_TERM;
00329         writel(plx_dmamode, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAMODE1);
00330         writel(A2818_TXFIFO, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMALADR1);
00331         writel(0x3, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMADPR1);
00332 // Rev 1.6
00333         a2818_mmiowb();
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*
00337         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00338 
00339         a2818_link_reset
00340 
00341         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00342 */
00343 static void a2818_link_reset(struct a2818_state *s)
00344 {
00345 #ifndef SETCLR
00346 // Rev. 1.6
00347         uint32_t a2818_ioctl_reg;
00348 
00349         a2818_ioctl_reg = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL);
00350         writel(a2818_ioctl_reg & ~A2818_LNKRST, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL);
00351 // Rev 1.6
00352         a2818_mmiowb();
00353         udelay(1000);
00354         writel(a2818_ioctl_reg | A2818_LNKRST, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL);
00355 #else
00356         writel(A2818_LNKRST, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL_CLR);
00357 // Rev 1.6
00358         a2818_mmiowb();
00359         udelay(1000);
00360         writel(A2818_LNKRST, s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL_SET);
00361 #endif
00362 // Rev 1.6
00363         a2818_mmiowb();
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*
00367         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00368 
00369         a2818_reset
00370 
00371         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00372 */
00373 static void a2818_reset(struct a2818_state *s)
00374 {
00375 // Rev 1.6
00376         uint32_t app;
00377 
00378         app = readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00379 
00380         /* Reset the PLX */
00381         writel(app | CNTRL_SW_RESET, s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00382 // Rev 1.6
00383         a2818_mmiowb();
00384         udelay(500);
00385         writel(app & ~CNTRL_SW_RESET, s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00386 
00387         app = readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00388 
00389         /* Reload EPROM stored configuration on the PLX */
00390         writel(app & ~CNTRL_CONF_RELOAD, s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00391         writel(app | CNTRL_CONF_RELOAD, s->plx_vir + PLX_CNTRL);
00392 // Rev 1.6
00393         a2818_mmiowb();
00394         udelay(1000);
00395 
00396         /* Perform a link reset on the A2818/V2718 */
00397         a2818_link_reset(s);
00398 }
00399 
00400 /*
00401         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00402 
00403         a2818_send_pkt
00404 
00405         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00406 */
00407 static int a2818_send_pkt(struct a2818_state *s, int slave, const char *buf, int count)
00408 {
00409         int nlw, i;
00410 
00411         /* 32-bit word alignment */
00412         nlw = (count >> 2) + (count & 3 ? 1 : 0) + 1;
00413 
00414         /* Se ho da spedire poco non faccio il DMA */
00415         if( nlw * 4 < MIN_DMA_SIZE ) {
00416                 for( i = 0; i < nlw; i++ )
00417                         writel(s->o_buf[slave][i], s->baseaddr + A2818_TXFIFO);
00418         } else {
00419 // Rev. 1.6
00420 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
00421                 writel(virt_to_bus(s->o_buf[slave]), s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAPADR1);
00422 #else
00423                 writel(s->o_buf_pci[slave], s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAPADR1);
00424 #endif
00425 
00426                 writel(nlw * 4, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMASIZE1);
00427 
00428                 // DMA start
00429                 writel( DMACSR_ENA_0| DMACSR_ENA_1 | DMACSR_START_1, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR);
00430 
00431                 // Check for DMA write completion ?
00432 // Rev 1.6
00433                a2818_mmiowb();
00434         }
00435 
00436         return count;
00437 }
00438 
00439 /*
00440         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00441 
00442         a2818_recv_pkt
00443 
00444         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00445 */
00446 static int a2818_recv_pkt(struct a2818_state *s, int slave, int *status)
00447 {
00448         int ret;
00449         // Rev 1.5
00450         // unsigned long flags;
00451         // int app;
00452         int i;
00453 // Rev. 1.6
00454         uint32_t tr_stat;
00455 
00456 
00457         DISABLE_RX_INT
00458 //  1.4: aggiunto spinlock
00459         spin_lock_irq( &s->Alock);
00460         if( !s->rx_ready[slave] && !s->DMAInProgress ) {
00461 //        if( !s->rx_ready[slave] && DMAREAD_DONE ) {
00462                 for( i = 0; i < 15; i++ ) {
00463                         tr_stat = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_TRSTAT);
00464 
00465                         if( tr_stat & 0xFFFF0000 ) {
00466                                 s->tr_stat = tr_stat;
00467                                 a2818_handle_rx_pkt(s, 0);
00468                                 break;
00469                         }
00470                 }
00471         }
00472 //  1.4: aggiunto spinlock
00473         spin_unlock_irq( &s->Alock);
00474 #if DEBUG
00475 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "s->il_buf_sz[%d] = %d - s->rx_ready[slave] = %d\n", slave, s->il_buf_sz[slave], s->rx_ready[slave] );
00476 #endif
00477         ENABLE_RX_INT
00478 
00479         ret = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00480                         s->read_wait[slave],
00481                         s->rx_ready[slave],
00482                         s->timeout
00483               );
00484 
00485 #if DEBUG
00486 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "wait-ret = %d\n", ret );
00487 #endif
00488         if( ret == 0 ) {
00489                 /* Timeout reached */
00490                 ret = -ETIMEDOUT;
00491                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Timeout on RX\n");
00492                 goto err_recv;
00493         } else if( ret < 0 ) {
00494                 /* Interrupted by a signal */
00495                 ret = -EINTR;
00496                 goto err_recv;
00497         }
00498 
00499         s->rx_ready[slave] = 0;
00500 
00501         ret = s->il_buf_sz[slave];
00502 
00503         put_user(s->rx_status[slave], (int *)status);
00504 
00505 #if DEBUG
00506 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "read-ret = %d\n", ret );
00507 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "s->rx_status[%d] = %x\n", slave, s->rx_status[slave]  );
00508 #endif
00509 
00510 err_recv:
00511         s->il_buf_sz[slave] = 0;
00512 
00513         return ret;
00514 }
00515 
00516 /*
00517         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00518 
00519         a2818_procinfo
00520 
00521         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00522 */
00523 static int a2818_procinfo(char *buf, char **start, off_t fpos, int lenght,
00524                           int *eof, void *data)
00525 {
00526         char *p;
00527         struct a2818_state* s = devs;
00528         int i = 0;
00529 
00530         p = buf;
00531         p += sprintf(p,"CAEN A2818 driver %s\n\n", DRIVER_VERSION);
00532 
00533         while( s ) {
00534                 p += sprintf(p, "  CAEN A2818 CONET Board found.\n");
00535 // Rev 1.6
00536                 p += sprintf(p, "  Physical address = %p\n", (void *)s->phys);
00537                 p += sprintf(p, "  Virtual address  = %p\n", s->baseaddr);
00538                 p += sprintf(p, "  IRQ line         = %d\n", (int)s->irq);
00539                 p += sprintf(p, "  Minor number     = %d\n", (int)s->minor);
00540                 p += sprintf(p, "  Reads            = %i\n", s->reads);
00541                 p += sprintf(p, "  Writes           = %i\n", s->writes);
00542                 p += sprintf(p, "  Ioctls           = %i\n", s->ioctls);
00543 //#if DEBUG
00544                 p += sprintf(p, "  Board fw rev     = %08X\n",
00545                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_FWREL));
00546                 p += sprintf(p, "  Board status     = %08X\n",
00547                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_STATUS));
00548                 p += sprintf(p, "  Transfer status  = %08X\n",
00549                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_TRSTAT));
00550                 p += sprintf(p, "  IOCTL            = %08X\n",
00551                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IOCTL));
00552                 p += sprintf(p, "  IRQSTAT0         = %08X\n",
00553                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT0));
00554                 p += sprintf(p, "  IRQSTAT1         = %08X\n",
00555                              readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT1));
00556                 p += sprintf(p, "  INTCSR           = %08X\n",
00557                              readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_INTCSR));
00558                 p += sprintf(p, "  DMAMODE          = %08X\n",
00559                              readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_DMAMODE0));
00560                 p += sprintf(p, "  CNTRL            = %08X\n",
00561                              readl(s->plx_vir + 0x6c));
00562                 p += sprintf(p, "  PLX_DMACSR       = %08X\n",
00563                              readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR));
00564 
00565 //#endif
00566                 p += sprintf(p,"\n");
00567 
00568                 s = s->next;
00569                 i++;
00570         }
00571 
00572         p += sprintf(p,"%d CAEN A2818 board(s) found.\n", i);
00573 
00574         *eof = 1;
00575         return p - buf;
00576 }

00585 static void a2818_register_proc(void)
00586 {
00587         a2818_procdir = create_proc_entry("a2818", S_IFREG | S_IRUGO, 0);

00589 }

00602 
00603 /*
00604         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00605 
00606         a2818_poll
00607 
00608         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00609 */
00610 static unsigned int a2818_poll(struct file* file, poll_table* wait)
00611 {
00612         struct a2818_state *s = (struct a2818_state *)file->private_data;
00613         unsigned int minor = MINOR(file->f_dentry->d_inode->i_rdev);
00614 
00615         if( s->rx_ready[minor] )
00616                 return POLLIN | POLLRDNORM;
00617         poll_wait(file, &s->read_wait[minor], wait);
00618         if( s->rx_ready[minor] )
00619                 return POLLIN | POLLRDNORM;
00620 
00621         return 0;
00622 }
00623 
00624 /*
00625         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00626 
00627         a2818_open
00628 
00629         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00630 */
00631 static int a2818_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00632 {
00633         unsigned int minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00634         struct a2818_state *s = devs;
00635         int slave = minor & 0xF;
00636 
00637         /* If minor is out of range, return an error */
00638         if( minor > MAX_MINOR ) {
00639                 return -ENODEV;
00640         }
00641 
00642         /* Search for the device linked to the minor */
00643 
00644         while( s && s->minor != (minor >> 4) )
00645                 s = s->next;
00646         if( !s )
00647                 return -ENODEV;
00648 
00649         /* v1.3d - Alloc in open can cause problems, kmalloc is now in init */
00650         if( !opened[minor] ) {
00651                 /* Alloc maximum size for DMA (out) */
00652 /*
00653                 s->o_buf[slave] = kmalloc(A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, GFP_KERNEL | GFP_DMA);
00654                 if (!(s->o_buf[slave])) {
00655                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "out of DMA memory\n");
00656                         return -ENODEV;
00657                 }
00658 */
00659                 s->o_buf_sz[slave] = 0;
00660                 s->il_buf_sz[slave] = 0;
00661                 s->rx_ready[slave] = 0;
00662                                 
00663         }
00664 
00665         file->private_data = s;
00666         opened[minor]++;
00667 #if DEBUG
00668         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Open eseguita!\n");
00669 #endif
00670         return(0);
00671 }
00672 
00673 /*
00674         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00675 
00676         a2818_release
00677 
00678         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00679 */
00680 static int a2818_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00681 {
00682         unsigned int minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00683         struct a2818_state *s = devs;
00684         // Rev 1.5
00685         // int slave = minor & 0xF;
00686 
00687         /* If minor is out of range, return an error */
00688         if( minor > MAX_MINOR ) {
00689                 return -ENODEV;
00690         }
00691 
00692         /* Search for the device linked to the minor */
00693         while( s && s->minor != (minor >> 4) )
00694                 s = s->next;
00695         if( !s )
00696                 return -ENODEV;
00697 
00698         opened[minor]--;
00699 //Rev 1.5
00700 /*      
00701         if( !opened[minor] ) {
00702 //                kfree(s->o_buf[slave]);
00703         }
00704 */
00705         return 0;
00706 }
00707 
00708 /*
00709         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00710 
00711         a2818_ioctl
00712 
00713         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00714 */
00715 static int a2818_ioctl(struct inode *inode,struct file *file,unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00716 {
00717         unsigned int minor;
00718         struct a2818_state *s;
00719         int ret = 0, slave;
00720         a2818_reg_t reg;
00721         a2818_intr_t intr;
00722         a2818_comm_t comm;
00723         // Rev 1.5
00724         // int retL;
00725 
00726         minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00727         s = (struct a2818_state *)file->private_data;
00728         slave = minor & 0xf;
00729 
00730         s->ioctls++;
00731 
00732         switch (cmd) {
00733                 case A2818_IOCTL_RESET:
00734                         a2818_reset(s);
00735                 break;
00736                                 // Rev 1.5
00737                 case A2818_IOCTL_REV:
00738                                         {
00739                                                 a2818_rev_t rev;
00740                         if( copy_from_user(&rev, (a2818_rev_t *)arg, sizeof(rev)) > 0 ) {
00741                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00742                                 break;
00743                         }
00744                                                 strcpy( rev.rev_buf, DRIVER_VERSION);
00745                         if( copy_to_user((a2818_rev_t *)arg, &rev, sizeof(rev)) > 0) {
00746                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00747                                 break;
00748                         }
00749                                         }
00750                 break;
00751                 case A2818_IOCTL_REG_RD:
00752                         if( copy_from_user(&reg, (a2818_reg_t *)arg, sizeof(reg)) > 0 ) {
00753                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00754                                 break;
00755                         }
00756                         reg.value = readl(s->baseaddr + reg.address);
00757                         if( copy_to_user((a2818_reg_t *)arg, &reg, sizeof(reg)) > 0) {
00758                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00759                                 break;
00760                         }
00761                 break;
00762                 case A2818_IOCTL_REG_WR:
00763                         if( copy_from_user(&reg, (a2818_reg_t *)arg, sizeof(reg)) > 0 ) {
00764                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00765                                 break;
00766                         }
00767                         writel(reg.value, s->baseaddr + reg.address);
00768 // Rev 1.6
00769                        a2818_mmiowb();
00770                 break;
00771                 case A2818_IOCTL_IRQ_WAIT:
00772                         if( copy_from_user(&intr, (a2818_intr_t *)arg, sizeof(intr)) > 0 ) {
00773                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00774                                 break;
00775                         }
00776                         if( slave < 4 ) {
00777                                 ret = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00778                                         s->intr_wait[slave],            // wait queue
00779                                         ((readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT0) >> (slave * 8)) & 0xFF) & intr.Mask,     // condition
00780                                         (intr.Timeout * HZ) / 1000     // timeout from ms to jiffies
00781                               );
00782                         } else {
00783                                 ret = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00784                                         s->intr_wait[slave],            // wait queue
00785                                         ((readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT1) >> (slave * 8)) & 0xFF) & intr.Mask,     // condition
00786                                         (intr.Timeout * HZ) / 1000     // timeout from ms to jiffies
00787                               );
00788                         }
00789                         if( ret == 0 ) {
00790                                 /* Timeout reached */
00791 //Rev 1.8                                
00792                                 /* !!!!! WARNING !!!!!!
00793                                 * The CAENVMElib needs to handle the ioctl return value to detect
00794                                 * IRQ timeout, so we must return a positive value to avoid Linux to
00795                                 * wrap the ioctl's return code to -1
00796                                 */
00797                                 ret = ETIMEDOUT;
00798                         } else if( ret < 0 ) {
00799                                 /* Interrupted by a signal */
00800                                 ret = -EINTR;
00801                         } else if( ret > 0 )
00802                         ret = 0;
00803                 break;
00804                 case A2818_IOCTL_COMM:
00805 
00806                         if( copy_from_user(&comm, (a2818_comm_t *)arg, sizeof(comm)) > 0 ) {
00807                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00808                                 break;
00809                         }
00810 
00811                         if( copy_from_user(&(s->o_buf[slave][1]), comm.out_buf, comm.out_count) > 0) {
00812                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00813                                 break;
00814                         }
00815 #if DEBUG
00816 {
00817     int i;
00818 
00819     for( i = 0; i < comm.out_count; i += 4 )
00820         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Dump pkt: %08lX\n", *((long *)(&comm.out_buf[i])));
00821 }
00822 #endif
00823 
00824 // Rev 1.5
00825 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00826                         s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave]= 0;  // resetta indice pagina attuale
00827                         s->il_buff_pages[ slave]= 0;        // resetta numero pagine allocate
00828 #endif
00829                         if( comm.in_count > 0 ) {
00830 
00831 // Rev 1.5
00832 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00833                                 ret = map_user_kiobuf(READ, s->il_buf[slave], (u32)comm.in_buf, comm.in_count);
00834                                 entryCnt++;
00835 
00836                                 if( ret ) {
00837                                         ret = -EFAULT;
00838                                         break;
00839                                 }
00840                                 ret = lock_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf, 1);
00841                                 if( ret ) {
00842                                         printk("ioctl - lock_kiovec error.\n");
00843                                         unmap_kiobuf(s->il_buf[slave]);
00844                                         ret = -EFAULT;
00845                                         break;
00846                                 }
00847 #else
00848 // Rev 1.6
00849                                if( ( s->il_buff_pages[ slave]= sgl_map_user_pages( s->il_buf[ slave], MAX_USER_PAGES, (unsigned long)comm.in_buf, comm.in_count, READ))<= 0)
00850                                {
00851                                    printk("ioctl send - sgl_map_user_pages (%d:%p %p %d).\n", ret, s->il_buf[slave],
00852                                    comm.in_buf, comm.in_count);
00853                                    ret = -EFAULT;
00854                                    break;
00855                                }
00856 #endif
00857                         }
00858                         /*
00859                             Ver. 1.2 - Link fail handling.
00860                         */
00861                         if( readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_STATUS) & A2818_LINK_FAIL ) {
00862 #if DEBUG
00863 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Link fail detected! Trying to reset ...\n");
00864 #endif
00865                             a2818_reset(s);
00866                             udelay(10000);  // Wait 10 ms per ora
00867                             if( readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_STATUS) & A2818_LINK_FAIL ) {
00868                                         ret = -EFAULT;
00869                                         // Ver. 1.7 - Before there was a break and it was a bad error handling
00870                                         goto err_comm;
00871                             }
00872                         }
00873                         if( comm.out_count > 0 ) {
00874                                 /* Build the header */
00875                                 s->o_buf[slave][0] = (slave << 24) | (slave << 16) | ((comm.out_count >> 1) & 0xFFFF);
00876                                 ret = a2818_send_pkt(s, slave, comm.out_buf, comm.out_count);
00877                                 if( ret < 0 ) {
00878                                         ret = -EFAULT;
00879                                         goto err_comm;
00880                                 }
00881                                 if( comm.in_count > 0 ) {
00882                                     ret = a2818_recv_pkt(s, slave, comm.status);
00883                                     if( ret < 0 ) {
00884                                             ret = -EFAULT;
00885                                             goto err_comm;
00886                                     }
00887                                 }
00888                         }
00889 err_comm:
00890 // Rev 1.5
00891 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00892                         unlock_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf);
00893                         unmap_kiobuf(s->il_buf[slave]);
00894                         entryCnt--;
00895 #else
00896                                                 sgl_unmap_user_pages( s->il_buf[ slave], s->il_buff_pages[ slave], 0);
00897 #endif
00898                 break;
00899 // Rev 1.7 - Better error handling for the link fail
00900                 case A2818_IOCTL_SEND:
00901 
00902                         if( copy_from_user(&comm, (a2818_comm_t *)arg, sizeof(comm)) > 0 ) {
00903                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00904                                 break;
00905                         }
00906 
00907                         if( copy_from_user(&(s->o_buf[slave][1]), comm.out_buf, comm.out_count) > 0) {
00908                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00909                                 break;
00910                         }
00911 #if DEBUG
00912 {
00913     int i;
00914 
00915     for( i = 0; i < comm.out_count; i += 4 )
00916         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Dump pkt: %08lX\n", *((long *)(&comm.out_buf[i])));
00917 }
00918 #endif
00919 
00920 
00921 // Rev 1.5
00922 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00923 
00924                         ret = map_user_kiobuf(READ, s->il_buf[slave], (u32)comm.in_buf, comm.in_count);
00925                         if( ret ) {
00926                                 printk("ioctl send - map_user_kiobuf error (%d:%p %p %d).\n", ret, s->il_buf[slave],
00927                                         comm.in_buf, comm.in_count);
00928                                 ret = -EACCES;
00929                                 break;
00930                         }
00931                         ret = lock_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf, 1);
00932                         if( ret ) {
00933                                 printk("ioctl - lock_kiovec error.\n");
00934                                 unmap_kiobuf(s->il_buf[slave]);
00935                                 ret = -EACCES;
00936                                 break;
00937                         }
00938 #else
00939                         s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave]= 0;              // resetta indice pagina attuale
00940 // Rev. 1.6
00941                         if( ( s->il_buff_pages[ slave]= sgl_map_user_pages( s->il_buf[ slave], MAX_USER_PAGES, (unsigned long)comm.in_buf, comm.in_count, READ))<= 0)
00942                         {
00943                             printk("ioctl send - sgl_map_user_pages (%d:%p %p %d).\n", ret, s->il_buf[slave],
00944                             comm.in_buf, comm.in_count);
00945                             ret = -EACCES;
00946                             break;
00947                         }
00948 
00949 #endif
00950                         /*
00951                             Ver. 1.2 - Link fail handling.
00952 
00953                         */
00954                         if( readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_STATUS) & A2818_LINK_FAIL ) {
00955 #if DEBUG
00956 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Link fail detected! Trying to reset ...\n");
00957 #endif
00958                             a2818_reset(s);
00959                             udelay(10000);  // Wait 10 ms per ora
00960                             if( readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_STATUS) & A2818_LINK_FAIL ) {
00961                                 ret = -EACCES;
00962                                 goto err_send;
00963                             }
00964                         }
00965 
00966                         if( comm.out_count > 0 ) {
00967                                 /* Build the header */
00968                                 s->o_buf[slave][0] = (slave << 24) | (slave << 16) | ((comm.out_count >> 1) & 0xFFFF);
00969                                 ret = a2818_send_pkt(s, slave, comm.out_buf, comm.out_count);
00970                                 if( ret < 0 ) {
00971                                         ret = -EFAULT;
00972                                         goto err_send;
00973                                 }
00974 
00975                         }
00976 err_send:
00977 // Rev 1.5
00978 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00979                                         unlock_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf);
00980                                         unmap_kiobuf(s->il_buf[slave]);
00981 #else
00982                                                                                 sgl_unmap_user_pages( s->il_buf[ slave], s->il_buff_pages[ slave], 0);
00983 #endif
00984                 break;
00985                 case A2818_IOCTL_RECV:
00986 
00987                         ret = a2818_recv_pkt(s, slave, (int *)arg);
00988                         if( ret < 0 ) {
00989                                 ret = -EFAULT;
00990                         }
00991 //
00992 // Rev 1.5
00993 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00994                         unlock_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf);
00995                         unmap_kiobuf(s->il_buf[slave]);
00996 #else
00997                                                 sgl_unmap_user_pages( s->il_buf[ slave], s->il_buff_pages[ slave], 0);
00998 #endif
00999                 break;
01000         }
01001 
01002         return ret;
01003 }
01004 
01005 /*
01006         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01007 
01008         a2818_ioctl_unlocked (Called in preference to a2818_ioctl on newer kernels)
01009 
01010         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01011 */
01012 
01013 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
01014 static long a2818_ioctl_unlocked(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
01015 {
01016         struct inode *inode = file->f_dentry->d_inode;
01017         struct a2818_state *s = (struct a2818_state *)file->private_data;
01018         long ret;
01019 
01020         /* ioctl() calls can cause the Big Kernel Lock (BKL) to be taken, which
01021          * can have significant performance penalties system-wide.  By providing
01022          * an unlocked ioctl() method the BKL will not be taken, but the driver
01023          * becomes responsible for its own locking.  Furthermore, the lock can be
01024          * broken down per A2818 so that multiple threads accessing different CONET
01025          * chains do not contend with one another during ioctl() calls.
01026          */
01027         mutex_lock(&s->ioctl_lock);
01028         ret = (long) a2818_ioctl(inode, file, cmd, arg);
01029         mutex_unlock(&s->ioctl_lock);
01030 
01031         return ret;
01032 }
01033 #endif
01034 
01035 /*
01036         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01037 
01038         a2818_handle_rx_pkt
01039 
01040         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01041 */
01042 static void a2818_handle_rx_pkt(struct a2818_state *s, int pp)
01043 {
01044         int DMA_size, i;
01045         // Rev 1.5
01046         // unsigned long flags;
01047 
01048         /* Disable interrupt on local bus */
01049         DISABLE_RX_INT
01050 
01051         /* Check on the length */
01052         DMA_size = (s->tr_stat >> 16) * 4;
01053 
01054 #if DEBUG
01055 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "DMA_size = %d\n", DMA_size );
01056 #endif
01057 
01058         if( DMA_size < MIN_DMA_SIZE ) {
01059                 for( i = 0; i < DMA_size/4; i++ )
01060                         *(u32 *)(s->i_buf+i*4) = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_RXFIFO);
01061                 s->i_buf_sz = DMA_size;
01062                 // Dispatch global buffer in per-slave buffers
01063                 a2818_dispatch_pkt(s);
01064                 ENABLE_RX_INT
01065         } else
01066         {
01067                 if( DMA_size <= A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ ) {
01068                         s->DMAInProgress = 1;
01069                         writel(DMA_size, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMASIZE0);
01070                         // DMA start
01071                         writel(DMACSR_ENA_0 | DMACSR_ENA_1| DMACSR_START_0, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR);
01072 // Rev 1.6
01073                        a2818_mmiowb();
01074                 } else {
01075                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "PROBLEMA SU DMA_Size %d\n", DMA_size );
01076                 }
01077         }
01078 
01079 }
01080 
01081 /*
01082         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01083 
01084         a2818_dispatch_pkt
01085 
01086         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01087 */
01088 
01089 // Rev 1.5
01090 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01091 /************************************
01092 * LINUX Rev. < 2.5.0
01093 *************************************/
01094 static void a2818_dispatch_pkt(struct a2818_state *s)
01095 {
01096         int i, j, pkt_sz, slave, nlw, last_pkt;
01097         int pg_idx, pg_off, pg_sz, cp_sz, tmp_sz;
01098         u32 header, dummy, mask = 0;
01099         u8 *buf;
01100         struct kiobuf *iobuf;
01101         char *i_buf = s->i_buf;
01102 
01103         i = 0;
01104         do {
01105                 pkt_sz = (i_buf[i] & 0xFF) + ((i_buf[i+1] << 8) & 0x0100);
01106                 last_pkt = i_buf[i+1] & 0x02;
01107                 i += 3;
01108                 slave = i_buf[i++] & 0xF;
01109                 mask |= 1 << slave;
01110                 nlw = (pkt_sz >> 1) + (pkt_sz & 1);
01111 
01112                 if( last_pkt ) {
01113 
01114                         pkt_sz -= 1;    // per togliere lo status
01115                         s->rx_status[slave] = (i_buf[i + pkt_sz * 2 - 1] << 8) +
01116                                                i_buf[i + pkt_sz * 2];
01117 #if DEBUG
01118 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "status = %02x slave = %02x\n", s->rx_status[slave], slave);
01119 #endif
01120                 }
01121 
01122                 if( slave >= MAX_V2718 ) {
01123 #if DEBUG
01124 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Wrong packet %04x %02x\n", pkt_sz, slave);
01125 #endif
01126                         return;
01127                 }
01128                 iobuf = s->il_buf[slave];
01129 #if DEBUG
01130 //printk(KERN_INFO PFX "pkt_sz 0x%04x - slave 0x%02x, %d\n", pkt_sz, slave, i );
01131 #endif
01132                 /* Some integrity checks */
01133                 if(
01134                     (iobuf->length > 0) &&
01135                     (nlw <= (s->i_buf_sz / 4)) &&
01136                     (slave < MAX_V2718) &&
01137                     (iobuf->nr_pages > 0) &&
01138                     (pkt_sz >= 0) &&
01139                     (pkt_sz <= 0x100)
01140                   ) {
01141                         tmp_sz = pkt_sz * 2;
01142                         while( tmp_sz > 0 ) {
01143                                 // Calcolo l'indice di pagina
01144                                 pg_idx = (s->il_buf_sz[slave] + iobuf->offset) / PAGE_SIZE;
01145                                 // Calcolo l'offset nella pagina
01146                                 pg_off = s->il_buf_sz[slave] - pg_idx * PAGE_SIZE + iobuf->offset;
01147                                 // Calcolo quanto posto ho nella pagina
01148                                 pg_sz = PAGE_SIZE - pg_off;
01149                                 // Calcolo quanto posso copiare questo giro
01150                                 cp_sz = MIN(pg_sz, tmp_sz);
01151 #if DEBUG
01152 //printk(KERN_INFO PFX "tmp_sz = %d, pg_off = %d, cp_sz = %d\n", tmp_sz, pg_off, cp_sz);
01153 //printk(KERN_INFO PFX "pg_sz = %d, iobuf_offset = %d, pg_idx = %d\n", pg_sz, iobuf->offset, pg_idx);
01154 #endif
01155                                 // Ottengo il puntatore in user space
01156                                 buf = (u8 *)(kmap_atomic(iobuf->maplist[pg_idx], KM_IRQ0) + pg_off);
01157                                 // Copio i dati arrivati
01158                                 memcpy(buf, &(i_buf[i]), cp_sz);
01159                                 kunmap_atomic(buf, KM_IRQ0);
01160 
01161                                 // Decremento tmp_sz di quello che ho copiato
01162                                 tmp_sz -= cp_sz;
01163                                 // Incremento il livello di utilizzo del buffer
01164                                 s->il_buf_sz[slave] += cp_sz;
01165                                 i += cp_sz;
01166                         }
01167                         if( last_pkt ) {
01168                                 i += 2; // to wipe out the status word
01169                                 s->rx_ready[slave] = 1;
01170                                 wake_up_interruptible(&s->read_wait[slave]);
01171                         }
01172                         i += i % 4;  // 32-bit alignment
01173                 } else {
01174                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Unhandled packet - slave %d, pkt_sz %d\n", slave, pkt_sz);
01175                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "nr_pg %d, len %d, buf_sz %d\n", iobuf->nr_pages, iobuf->length, s->i_buf_sz);
01176                         break;
01177                 }
01178         } while( i < s->i_buf_sz );
01179 #if DEBUG
01180 //        printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Esco dalla dispatch_pkt\n");
01181 #endif
01182 
01183 }
01184 #else
01185 /************************************
01186 * LINUX Rev. >= 2.5.0
01187 *************************************/
01188 static void a2818_dispatch_pkt(struct a2818_state *s)
01189 {
01190         int i, pkt_sz, slave, nlw, last_pkt;
01191         int tmp_sz;
01192         u32 mask = 0;
01193         char *i_buf = s->i_buf;
01194 
01195         i = 0;
01196         do {
01197                 pkt_sz = (i_buf[i] & 0xFF) + ((i_buf[i+1] << 8) & 0x0100);
01198                 last_pkt = i_buf[i+1] & 0x02;
01199                 i += 3;
01200                 slave = i_buf[i++] & 0xF;
01201                 mask |= 1 << slave;
01202                 nlw = (pkt_sz >> 1) + (pkt_sz & 1);
01203 
01204                 if( last_pkt ) {
01205                         pkt_sz -= 1;    // per togliere lo status
01206                         s->rx_status[slave] = (i_buf[i + pkt_sz * 2 - 1] << 8) +
01207                                                i_buf[i + pkt_sz * 2];
01208 #if DEBUG
01209 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "status = %02x slave = %02x\n", s->rx_status[slave], slave);
01210 #endif
01211                 }
01212 
01213                 if( slave >= MAX_V2718 ) {
01214 #if DEBUG
01215 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Wrong packet %04x %02x\n", pkt_sz, slave);
01216 #endif
01217                         return;
01218                 }
01219 #if DEBUG
01220 //printk(KERN_INFO PFX "pkt_sz 0x%04x - slave 0x%02x, %d\n", pkt_sz, slave, i );
01221 #endif
01222                 /* Some integrity checks */
01223                 if(
01224                     (nlw <= (s->i_buf_sz / 4)) &&
01225                     (slave < MAX_V2718) &&
01226                                 s->il_buf[slave] &&
01227                     (pkt_sz >= 0) &&
01228                     (pkt_sz <= 0x100)
01229                   ) {
01230 
01231                         tmp_sz = pkt_sz * 2;
01232                                                 while( tmp_sz> 0)
01233                                                 {
01234                                                         int act_page_id= s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave];
01235                                                         int cp_sz;
01236                                                         char* buf;
01237                                                                                                 
01238                                                         if( act_page_id>= s->il_buff_pages[slave])
01239                                                         {
01240                                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Bad page Id - slave: %d, page_id: %d length: %d offset: %d\n", slave, act_page_id, s->il_buf[slave][ act_page_id].length, s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset);
01241                                                                 return;
01242                                                                 
01243                                                         }
01244                                                         
01245                                                         cp_sz= (( PAGE_SIZE- s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset)> tmp_sz)? tmp_sz: ( PAGE_SIZE- s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset);
01246                                                         
01247                             // Ottengo il puntatore in user space
01248                             buf = (u8 *)(kmap_atomic( s->il_buf[slave][ act_page_id].page, KM_IRQ0) + s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset);
01249                             // Copio i dati arrivati
01250                             memcpy(buf, &(i_buf[i]), cp_sz);
01251                             kunmap_atomic(buf, KM_IRQ0);
01252                             tmp_sz -= cp_sz;
01253                                 s->il_buf_sz[slave] += cp_sz;
01254                                 i += cp_sz;
01255                                                         s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset+= cp_sz;
01256 
01257                                                         if( s->il_buf[slave][act_page_id].offset>= PAGE_SIZE)
01258                                                         {
01259                                                                 s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave]++;
01260                                                         }
01261                                                 }
01262                         if( last_pkt ) {
01263                                 i += 2; // to wipe out the status word
01264                                 s->rx_ready[slave] = 1;
01265                                 wake_up_interruptible(&s->read_wait[slave]);
01266                         }
01267                         i += i % 4;  // 32-bit alignment
01268                 } else {
01269                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Unhandled packet - slave %d, pkt_sz %d\n", slave, pkt_sz);
01270 // Rev. 1.6
01271                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "nr_pg %d, len %d, page %p\n", s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave], s->il_buf[slave][ s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave]].length, s->il_buf[slave][ s->il_buff_act_page_id[ slave]].page);
01272                         break;
01273                 }
01274         } while( i < s->i_buf_sz );
01275 #if DEBUG
01276 //        printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Esco dalla dispatch_pkt\n");
01277 #endif
01278 }
01279 #endif
01280 
01281 /*
01282         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01283 
01284         a2818_handle_vme_irq
01285 
01286         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01287 */
01288 static void a2818_handle_vme_irq(u32 irq0, u32 irq1, struct a2818_state *s)
01289 {
01290         int i;
01291 
01292 #if DEBUG
01293 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "irq0 0x%08x - irq1 0x%08x\n", irq0, irq1);
01294 #endif
01295         for( i = 0; i < MAX_V2718; i++ ) {
01296                 /* Save IRQ levels on global struct */
01297                 // Perche' ? non e' meglio andare a rileggere i registri nella ioctl ?
01298                 s->intr[i] = ((i < 4 ? irq0 : irq1) & (0xFF << (i * 8))) >> (i * 8);
01299                 if( s->intr[i] )
01300                         /* Qui bisognerebbe disabilitare le interrupt che sono
01301                            state ricevute, ma come e' ora il fw non e' banale
01302                         */
01303                         /* Wake up sleeping processes */
01304                         wake_up_interruptible(&s->intr_wait[i]);
01305         }
01306 // Per ora disabilito tutto, poi forse potro' farlo singolarmente
01307         DISABLE_VME_INT
01308 }
01309 
01310 /*
01311         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01312 
01313         a2818_interrupt
01314 
01315         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01316 */
01317 
01318 // Rev 1.5
01319 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01320 static void a2818_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_id, struct pt_regs *regs)
01321 {
01322         #define IRQ_HANDLED
01323 #else
01324 static irqreturn_t a2818_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_id, struct pt_regs *regs)
01325 {
01326 #endif
01327         struct a2818_state *s = (struct a2818_state *)dev_id;
01328 // Rev. 1.6
01329         uint32_t plx_intcsr = 0;
01330 // Rev 1.5
01331 //        unsigned long data, header;
01332 //        int nw, nlw, i, app;
01333 // Rev. 1.6
01334         uint32_t tr_stat;
01335 
01336 // 1.4
01337         spin_lock( &s->Alock);
01338 
01339         /* Read PLX interrupt register */
01340         plx_intcsr = readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_INTCSR);
01341 
01342         if( !(plx_intcsr & (INTCSR_DMA1_INT_ACT | INTCSR_DMA0_INT_ACT | INTCSR_LOC_INT_ACT)))
01343         {
01344 // 1.4
01345                 spin_unlock( &s->Alock);
01346                 return IRQ_HANDLED;
01347         }
01348 
01349 
01350 #if DEBUG
01351         if( plx_intcsr & (INTCSR_DMA1_INT_ACT | INTCSR_DMA0_INT_ACT | INTCSR_LOC_INT_ACT) )
01352                 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Entro nell'interrupt - %.8x\n", plx_intcsr);
01353 #endif
01354         /* DMA write interrupt ? */
01355         if( plx_intcsr & INTCSR_DMA1_INT_ACT ) {
01356                 writel( DMACSR_ENA_0| DMACSR_ENA_1| DMACSR_CLRINT_1, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR);
01357 // Rev 1.6
01358                 a2818_mmiowb();
01359                 /* Per ora non faccio niente, poi si vedra' */
01360         }
01361 
01362         /* DMA read interrupt ? */
01363         if( plx_intcsr & INTCSR_DMA0_INT_ACT ) {
01364 
01365                 writel(DMACSR_ENA_0| DMACSR_ENA_1| DMACSR_CLRINT_0, s->plx_vir + PLX_DMACSR);
01366 
01367                 s->i_buf_sz = readl(s->plx_vir + PLX_DMASIZE0);
01368                 s->DMAInProgress = 0;
01369 #if DEBUG
01370 printk(KERN_INFO PFX "DMA-size read = %d\n", s->i_buf_sz);
01371 #endif
01372 //printk(KERN_INFO PFX "DMA-size read = %d - minor = %d\n", s->i_buf_sz, s->minor);
01373                 /* Re-enable interrupt on local bus */
01374 
01375                 ENABLE_RX_INT
01376 
01377                 /* Dispatch global buffer in per-slave buffers */
01378                 a2818_dispatch_pkt(s);
01379 
01380 #if DEBUG
01381         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "DMA done\n");
01382 #endif
01383         }
01384 
01385        /* Check if the interrupt comes from the A2818 (pkt rx or VME irq)*/
01386         if( plx_intcsr & INTCSR_LOC_INT_ACT ) {
01387                 u32 irq0, irq1;
01388 
01389                 /* VME interrupt ? */
01390                 irq0 = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT0);
01391                 irq1 = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_IRQSTAT1);
01392 #if DEBUG
01393 //        printk(KERN_INFO PFX "irq0 = %#lx - irq1 = %#lx\n", irq0, irq1);
01394 #endif
01395                 if( irq0 | irq1 ) {
01396                         a2818_handle_vme_irq(irq0, irq1, s);
01397                 }
01398 
01399                 if( !(s->DMAInProgress) ) {
01400 //                if( DMAREAD_DONE ) {
01401                         /*
01402                         Check if the interrupt is due to the receive of a packet or
01403                         if during the previous DMA transfer a packet is arrived
01404                         */
01405                         tr_stat = readl(s->baseaddr + A2818_TRSTAT);
01406 #if DEBUG
01407         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "trstat = %#lx\n", (long)tr_stat);
01408 #endif
01409                         if( tr_stat & 0xFFFF0000 ) {
01410                                 s->tr_stat = tr_stat;
01411                                 a2818_handle_rx_pkt(s, 0);
01412                         }
01413                 }
01414         }
01415 
01416 #if DEBUG
01417 //        if( plx_intcsr & (INTCSR_DMA1_INT_ACT | INTCSR_DMA0_INT_ACT | INTCSR_LOC_INT_ACT) )
01418 //                printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Esco dall'interrupt - %.8x\n", plx_intcsr);
01419 #endif
01420 
01421 // 1.4
01422         spin_unlock( &s->Alock);
01423         
01424         return IRQ_HANDLED;
01425 }
01426 
01427 /*
01428         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01429 
01430         a2818_init_board
01431 
01432         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01433 */
01434 static void a2818_init_board(struct pci_dev *pcidev, int index)
01435 {
01436         struct a2818_state *s;
01437         int i;
01438 
01439 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,3,0)
01440         if (pci_enable_device(pcidev))
01441                 return;
01442 #endif
01443         if (pcidev->irq == 0)
01444                 return;
01445 
01446         s = kmalloc(sizeof(*s), GFP_KERNEL);
01447         if (!s) {
01448                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "out of memory\n");
01449                 return;
01450         }
01451 
01452         memset(s, 0, sizeof(struct a2818_state));
01453 
01454         s->DMAInProgress = 0;
01455 // Rev. 1.6
01456 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,9)
01457         s->pcidev = pcidev;
01458 #endif
01459 
01460 // 1.4
01461         spin_lock_init( &s->Alock);
01462 // Rev. 1.6
01463 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
01464         mutex_init(&s->ioctl_lock);
01465 #endif
01466         for( i = 0; i < MAX_V2718; i++ ) {
01467                 init_waitqueue_head(&s->read_wait[i]);
01468                 init_waitqueue_head(&s->intr_wait[i]);
01469                 /*
01470                         Alloc all the DMA output buffers
01471                         v1.3d - Moved here from open function
01472                 */
01473 // Rev. 1.6
01474 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01475                 s->o_buf[i] = kmalloc(A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, GFP_KERNEL | GFP_DMA);
01476 #else
01477                 s->o_buf[i] = dma_alloc_coherent(&pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ,
01478                                                  &s->o_buf_pci[i], GFP_KERNEL);
01479 #endif
01480                 //
01481                 // Rev 1.5
01482                 if (!(s->o_buf[i])) {
01483                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "out of DMA memory s->o_buf i: %d\n", i);
01484                         goto err_kmalloc1;
01485                 }
01486         }
01487         
01488         /* Alloc maximum size for DMA (in) */
01489 // Rev. 1.6
01490 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01491         s->i_buf = kmalloc(A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, GFP_KERNEL | GFP_DMA);
01492 #else
01493         s->i_buf = dma_alloc_coherent(&pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, &s->i_buf_pci, GFP_KERNEL);
01494 #endif
01495         if (!(s->i_buf)) {
01496                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "out of DMA memory s->i_buf\n");
01497                 goto err_kmalloc1;
01498         }
01499 
01500 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,3,0)
01501         s->phys = pci_resource_start(pcidev, 2);
01502         if (s->phys == 0)
01503                 return;
01504         if (!request_mem_region(s->phys, A2818_REGION_SIZE, "a2818")) {
01505                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "io mem %#lx-%#lx in use\n",
01506                 s->phys, s->phys + A2818_REGION_SIZE - 1);
01507                 goto err_region2;
01508         }
01509         /* Mapping of PLX control registers */
01510         s->plx_phy = pci_resource_start(pcidev, 0);
01511         if (!request_mem_region(s->plx_phy, PLX_REGION_SIZE, "a2818_plx")) {
01512                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "io mem %#lx-%#lx in use\n",
01513                 s->plx_phy, s->plx_phy + PLX_REGION_SIZE - 1);
01514                 goto err_region1;
01515         }
01516 #else
01517         s->phys = pcidev->base_address[2] & PCI_BASE_ADDRESS_MEM_MASK;
01518         s->plx_phy = pcidev->base_address[0] & PCI_BASE_ADDRESS_MEM_MASK;
01519 #endif
01520 
01521         s->plx_vir = (unsigned char *)ioremap(s->plx_phy, PLX_REGION_SIZE - 1);
01522         s->baseaddr = (char *)ioremap(s->phys, A2818_REGION_SIZE);
01523         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "found A2818 adapter at iomem %#08lx irq %u, PLX at %#08lx\n",
01524                 s->phys, s->irq, s->plx_phy);
01525 
01526         s->irq = pcidev->irq;
01527         /* request irq */
01528         if (request_irq(s->irq, a2818_interrupt, SA_SHIRQ, "a2818", s)) {
01529                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "irq %u in use\n", s->irq);
01530                 goto err_irq;
01531         }
01532 
01533         a2818_reset(s);
01534 
01535         a2818_enable_int(s);
01536         a2818_dma_conf(s);
01537 
01538 #if DEBUG
01539         printk("04 = 0x%08x\n", readl(s->plx_vir + 0x04));
01540         printk("18 = 0x%08x\n", readl(s->plx_vir + 0x18));
01541         printk("0c = 0x%08x\n", readl(s->plx_vir + 0x0c));
01542         printk("68 = 0x%08x\n", readl(s->plx_vir + 0x68));
01543 #endif
01544         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "  CAEN A2818 Loaded.\n");
01545 
01546         a2818_register_proc();
01547         s->i_buf_sz = 0;
01548         s->minor = index;
01549         s->timeout = 1500;
01550 
01551 // Rev 1.5      
01552 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01553         if (alloc_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf) < 0) {
01554                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "unable to alloc kiovec\n");
01555                 goto err_irq;
01556         }
01557 #else
01558                 {
01559                         int i; 
01560                         for( i= 0; i< MAX_V2718; i++)
01561                         {
01562                                 s->il_buf[i]= kmalloc( sizeof( struct scatterlist)*MAX_USER_PAGES, GFP_KERNEL);
01563                                 if( s->il_buf[i]== 0)
01564                                 {
01565                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "unable to alloc scatterlist buffers\n");
01566                         goto err_irq;
01567                                 }
01568                         }
01569                 }
01570 #endif
01571         /* queue it for later freeing */
01572         s->next = devs;
01573         devs = s;
01574         return;
01575 
01576 err_irq:
01577         iounmap(s->baseaddr);
01578         iounmap(s->plx_vir);
01579 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,3,0)
01580         release_mem_region(s->plx_phy, PLX_REGION_SIZE);
01581 #endif
01582 // Rev 1.5      
01583 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01584 #else
01585                 {
01586                         int i; 
01587                         for( i= 0; i< MAX_V2718; i++)
01588                         {
01589                                 kfree( s->il_buf[i]);
01590                         }
01591                 }
01592 #endif
01593 
01594 err_region1:
01595 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,3,0)
01596         release_mem_region(s->phys, A2818_REGION_SIZE);
01597 #endif
01598         /*
01599                 Free all the DMA output buffer
01600                 v1.3d - Moved here from open function
01601         */
01602         {
01603                 int i;
01604                 for( i = 0; i < MAX_V2718; i++ ) {
01605 // Rev. 1.6
01606                         if (s->o_buf[i]) {
01607 
01608 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01609                                 kfree(s->o_buf[i]);
01610 #else
01611                                 dma_free_coherent(&pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ,
01612                                                   s->o_buf[i], s->o_buf_pci[i]);
01613 #endif
01614                         }
01615                 }
01616         }
01617 
01618 err_region2:
01619 // Rev. 1.6
01620 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01621         kfree(s->i_buf);
01622 #else
01623         dma_free_coherent(&pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, s->i_buf, s->i_buf_pci);
01624 #endif
01625 
01626 err_kmalloc1:
01627 
01628         kfree(s);
01629 
01630         return;
01631 }
01632 
01633 /*
01634         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01635 
01636         a2818_init
01637 
01638         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01639 */
01640 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,3,0)
01641 static int init_module(void)
01642 #else
01643 static int __init a2818_init(void)
01644 #endif
01645 {
01646         struct pci_dev *pcidev = NULL;
01647         int index = 0;
01648         
01649 /*
01650   from 2.6 on pci_present is obsolete:
01651   From http://www.linux-m32r.org/lxr/http/source/Documentation/pci.txt?v=2.6.10 ...
01652 ' ... Since ages, you don't need to test presence
01653   of PCI subsystem when trying to talk to it.
01654   If it's not there, the list of PCI devices
01655   is empty and all functions for searching for
01656   devices just return NULL. '
01657 */
01658 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01659         #ifdef CONFIG_PCI
01660                 if (!pci_present())   /* No PCI bus in this machine! */
01661                         return -ENODEV;
01662         #endif
01663 #endif
01664         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "CAEN A2818 CONET controller driver %s\n", DRIVER_VERSION);
01665         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "  Copyright 2004, CAEN SpA\n");
01666 
01667 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,3,0)
01668         while (index < MAX_MINOR && (
01669         (pcidev = pci_find_device(PCI_VENDOR_ID_PLX, PCI_DEVICE_ID_PLX_9054, pcidev)))) {
01670                 unsigned short ss_id;
01671 
01672                 pci_read_config_word(pcidev, PCI_SUBSYSTEM_ID, &ss_id);
01673 
01674                 if( ss_id == PCI_SUBDEVICE_ID_CAEN_A2818 ) {
01675                         a2818_init_board(pcidev, index);
01676                         index++;
01677                 }
01678         }
01679 #elif LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01680         while (index < MAX_MINOR && (
01681                (pcidev = pci_find_subsys(PCI_VENDOR_ID_PLX,
01682                                          PCI_DEVICE_ID_PLX_9054,
01683                                          PCI_VENDOR_ID_PLX,
01684                                          PCI_SUBDEVICE_ID_CAEN_A2818,
01685                                         pcidev))) ) {
01686                 a2818_init_board(pcidev, index);
01687                 index++;
01688         }
01689 #else
01690                 while (index < MAX_MINOR && (
01691                  (pcidev = pci_get_subsys(PCI_VENDOR_ID_PLX,
01692                                            PCI_DEVICE_ID_PLX_9054,
01693                                            PCI_VENDOR_ID_PLX,
01694                                            PCI_SUBDEVICE_ID_CAEN_A2818,
01695                                           pcidev))) ) {
01696                   a2818_init_board(pcidev, index);
01697                   index++;
01698                 }
01699                 if( !index)
01700                         // No PCI device found
01701                         return -ENODEV;
01702 
01703 #endif
01704 /* 
01705            Ver. 1.8 - Register device only if HW is present otherwise the kernel
01706                       crashes with a cat /proc/devices
01707 */
01708     if( index > 0 ) {
01709         /* register device only if HW is present*/
01710         a2818_major = register_chrdev(0, "a2818", &a2818_fops);
01711         if ( a2818_major < 0 ) {
01712             printk(KERN_INFO PFX "  Error getting Major Number.\n");
01713             return -ENODEV;
01714         }
01715          }
01716         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "  CAEN A2818: %d device(s) found.\n", index);
01717 
01718         return 0;
01719 }
01720 
01721 /*
01722         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01723 
01724         a2818_cleanup
01725 
01726         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01727 */
01728 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,3,0)
01729 static void cleanup_module(void)
01730 #else
01731 static void __exit a2818_cleanup(void)
01732 #endif
01733 {
01734         struct a2818_state *s;
01735         int i;
01736 
01737         while ((s = devs)) {
01738                 devs = devs->next;
01739 
01740                 free_irq(s->irq, s);
01741 
01742                 iounmap(s->plx_vir);
01743                 iounmap(s->baseaddr);
01744 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,3,0)
01745                 release_mem_region(s->phys, A2818_REGION_SIZE);
01746                 release_mem_region(s->plx_phy, PLX_REGION_SIZE);
01747 #endif
01748 // Rev. 1.6
01749 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01750                 kfree(s->i_buf);
01751 #else
01752                 dma_free_coherent(&s->pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ, s->i_buf, s->i_buf_pci);
01753 #endif
01754 
01755 // Rev 1.5
01756 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
01757                 free_kiovec(MAX_V2718, s->il_buf);
01758 #endif
01759                 kfree(s);
01760 // 1.4
01761                 for( i = 0; i < MAX_V2718; i++ ) {
01762 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,9)
01763                     kfree( s->o_buf[i]);
01764 #else
01765                     dma_free_coherent(&s->pcidev->dev, A2818_MAX_PKT_SZ,
01766                                       s->o_buf[i], s->o_buf_pci[i]);
01767 #endif
01768 
01769 // Rev 1.5
01770 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
01771                                         kfree( s->il_buf[i]);
01772 #endif
01773 
01774                 }
01775         }
01776         a2818_unregister_proc();
01777         unregister_chrdev(a2818_major, "a2818");
01778         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN A2818: unloading.\n");
01779 
01780 }
01781 
01782 
01783 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
01784 /*
01785         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01786 
01787         sgl_map_user_pages: copied from /drivers/scsi/st.c
01788 
01789         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01790 */
01791 /* The following functions may be useful for a larger audience. */
01792 static int sgl_map_user_pages(struct scatterlist *sgl, const unsigned int max_pages,
01793                               unsigned long uaddr, size_t count, int rw)
01794 {
01795         int res, i, j;
01796         unsigned int nr_pages;
01797         struct page **pages;
01798 
01799         nr_pages = ((uaddr & ~PAGE_MASK) + count + ~PAGE_MASK) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
01800 
01801         // User attempted Overflow! 
01802         if ((uaddr + count) < uaddr)
01803                 return -EINVAL;
01804 
01805         // Too big 
01806         if (nr_pages > max_pages)
01807                 return -ENOMEM;
01808 
01809         // Hmm? 
01810         if (count == 0)
01811                 return 0;
01812 
01813         if ((pages = kmalloc(max_pages * sizeof(*pages), GFP_KERNEL)) == NULL)
01814                 return -ENOMEM;
01815         // Try to fault in all of the necessary pages 
01816         down_read(&current->mm->mmap_sem);
01817         // rw==READ means read from drive, write into memory area
01818         
01819         res = get_user_pages(
01820                 current,
01821                 current->mm,
01822                 uaddr,
01823                 nr_pages,
01824                 rw == READ,
01825                 0, 
01826                 pages,
01827                 NULL);
01828         up_read(&current->mm->mmap_sem);
01829 
01830         // Errors and no page mapped should return here
01831         if (res < nr_pages)
01832                 goto out_unmap;
01833 
01834         for (i=0; i < nr_pages; i++) {
01835                                 //
01836                 // FIXME: flush superflous for rw==READ,
01837                 // probably wrong function for rw==WRITE
01838                 //
01839                 flush_dcache_page(pages[i]);
01840         }
01841 
01842         // Populate the scatter/gather list
01843         sgl[0].page = pages[0]; 
01844         sgl[0].offset = uaddr & ~PAGE_MASK;
01845         if (nr_pages > 1) {
01846                 sgl[0].length = PAGE_SIZE - sgl[0].offset;
01847                 count -= sgl[0].length;
01848                 for (i=1; i < nr_pages ; i++) {
01849                         sgl[i].offset = 0;
01850                         sgl[i].page = pages[i]; 
01851                         sgl[i].length = count < PAGE_SIZE ? count : PAGE_SIZE;
01852                         count -= PAGE_SIZE;
01853                 }
01854         }
01855         else {
01856                 sgl[0].length = count;
01857         }
01858 
01859         kfree(pages);
01860         return nr_pages;
01861 
01862  out_unmap:
01863         if (res > 0) {
01864                 for (j=0; j < res; j++)
01865                         page_cache_release(pages[j]);
01866         }
01867         kfree(pages);
01868 //NDA: modified from st.c       
01869 //      return res ;
01870         return ( res> 0) ? -res: res ;
01871 }
01872 
01873 
01874 /*
01875         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01876 
01877         sgl_unmap_user_pages: copied from /drivers/scsi/st.c
01878 
01879         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01880 */
01881 /* And unmap them... */
01882 static int sgl_unmap_user_pages(struct scatterlist *sgl, const unsigned int nr_pages,
01883                                 int dirtied)
01884 {
01885         int i;
01886 
01887         for (i=0; i < nr_pages; i++) {
01888                 if (dirtied && !PageReserved(sgl[i].page))
01889                         SetPageDirty(sgl[i].page);
01890                 /* FIXME: cache flush missing for rw==READ
01891                  * FIXME: call the correct reference counting function
01892                  */
01893                 page_cache_release(sgl[i].page);
01894         }
01895 
01896         return 0;
01897 }
01898 #endif
01899

01903 module_exit(a2818_cleanup);
01904 #endif
